title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act". It pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research Enhancement Act establishes the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency. The Deputy Administrator will be appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate. The President appoints the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency with the advice and consent of the Senate. When making appointments, the President must consider recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, the National Academy of Engineering, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency oversees the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, the Science Advisory Board, and the Science Policy Council. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for scientific and technical activities in the regulatory program and regional offices. They also ensure important scientific issues are identified and oversee Agency-wide development. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for developing and overseeing an Agency-wide strategy to acquire and disseminate necessary scientific information through various programs involving academia, government agencies, and the private sector in the United States and foreign countries. They also ensure that the complex scientific outreach and communication needs of the Agency are met. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the EPA is tasked with coordinating credible science for regulatory and policy decisions, both internally and externally. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the EPA oversees scientific quality assurance, peer-review activities, and ensures appropriate scientific information is used in decision-making at all levels in the Agency. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development ensures that scientific and technical information used in regulatory decisions is valid, characterized with scientific uncertainty, and applied appropriately. The appointment term for this position is 6 years. The Agency's development involves appointing individuals for a 6-year term. This applies to appointments made after the enactment of this subsection. The Office of Research and Development Laboratories will establish a program to recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research. The Office of Research and Development Laboratories will make awards to senior researchers to support research in rapidly advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers with exceptional promise. Selection procedures will be established for this purpose. The Office of Research and Development Laboratories will establish procedures for selecting award recipients, including consultation with advisory boards. Awards will be for a 5-year period and may be renewed. Each laboratory must have at least 1 senior researcher appointed under the program. Authorization of appropriations is also provided. The Office of Research and Development will establish procedures for selecting award recipients and provide authorization of appropriations. The Office aims to give research managers flexibility and accountability in decision-making. The Office of Research and Development aims to maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, implement a strategy for acquiring research from various sources, and improve transparency in decision-making processes. The Office for Research and Development focuses on transparency in decision-making processes, including establishing priorities, making assignments, and allocating funds. The Administrator of the Agency is tasked with increasing efforts to disseminate research products and ongoing projects actively. The Office for Research and Development aims to explain the significance of research products and projects, assist in applying results, and expand the science inventory through comprehensive documentation and publication. The Office for Research and Development plans to publish a detailed inventory of scientific activities conducted by Agency units, including project goals, milestones, principal investigators, staff allocations, and financial resources. This inventory will be used to ensure proper management of these activities. The Office for Research and Development plans to publish a detailed inventory of scientific activities conducted by Agency units to ensure proper management. The activities described in the clause are coordinated through the Agency-wide science planning and budgeting process and peer-reviewed. The peer-review policy of the Agency will be changed to ensure greater independence of peer reviews from program managers. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is now the "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency". Any reference to the Deputy Administrator of the EPA in laws, maps, regulations, or other records will now refer to the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management. The Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is now the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency, as per the amendment to Section 5314 of title 5, United States Code.
